page.title: 02Home Life in the Villages
page.content:
The home life of today's housewife in the country villages is very different from that of her counterpart of 50 years ago. All the houses have mains water supply and electricity. They all have bathrooms and a modern kitchen, where equipment usually includes an electric cooker, washing machines, food mixers, electric kettles and irons are common. Fridges are very necessary and freezers for the storage of surplus garden produce.
Open fires are still very popular because there is plenty of wood available locally for fuel, 75 percent of the homes have a telephone, which is the major form of communication. Radios, record players & TV sets form the entertainment in most homes. Video Recorders are popular with younger families.
